qas.question: Slovo, slava, and slukh all originate from what Proto-Indo-European root?
The Ancient Greek κλῆς (klês - "famous") helped create what famous name?
What three words originated from the Proto-Indo-European root *ḱlew- ("be spoken of, fame")?

answers.text: he word slovo ("word") and the related slava ("fame") and slukh ("hearing")

qas.question: What does the Latin word "klew" mean?
What is the Latin word for famous?
What does the word "klew" originate from?
What type of root word is Pericles?

context: T<a2_0>he word slovo ("word") and the related slava ("fame") and <b7_0>slukh<b7_0/> ("hearing")<a2_0/> originate from the <b6_0>Proto-Indo-European<b6_0/> root <a0_0>*ḱlew<a0_0/>- ("<b3_0>be spoken of, fame<b3_0/>"), cognate with Ancient Greek κλῆς (<b4_0>klês<b4_0/> - "famous"), whence the name <a1_0>Pericles<a1_0/>, and Latin <b5_0>clueo<b5_0/> ("be called"), and English loud.
